fields.description:
Description:
When testing KitchenSink iPad, I clicked "Show popover" to enable a popover, and while it was displayed, rotated the device 270 degrees. The popover became disjointed from the button. I repeated the test with the remaining two buttons and found the same problem. In the case of "popover 1" the popover display also had some rendering problems resulting in its being unusable. See attached screenshots

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install Kitchensink iPad on device built with SDK 1.8.2
2) Click "Open Main Tests" button
3) Click "Popovers"
4) Click "Show popover 1"
5) With the popover displayed, rotate the device 270 degrees

Result:
The popover may disappear. Continue to rotate the device in 90 degree increments and the popover should appear with rendering problems

Expected:
The popover remains usable and attached to the button that spawned it.

Note:
This also occurs in SDK 1.8.1
Repeat with other popovers for better illustration of the disjointed problem
fields.summary: iOS: popover - Rotating device 270 degrees with popover displayed causes rendering and location problems
